comment:
The class itself isn't difficult, but MANY assignments. 
The quizzes and Exams consist of a blend of multiple-choice and written responses. 
Quizzes and Exams have both multiple-choice and written responses
Missing class means extra work, but you can catch up and redo assignments for a better grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr Arias is a super sweet professor. She makes this class a lot better then it is. The workload in this class is unreasonable so be prepared to do a ton of assignments. If there is someone better I would take them but she is a decent back up choice

Dr. Arias is very kind, but she is a very hard grader. You really have to make sure you are going above and beyond on your assignments. She does take some time to grade, but will give you time to resubmit assignments.

Class material was easy, took it online and could get everything done in a few hours. Assignments and tests were easy, but it was A LOT of things to do. Each week has a module, quiz, lab, and explanations. She is so caring though and after asking for feedback mid way through the semester, cut back on assignments. Responds to emails quickly too.

i love this professor she's so involved in the class and wants you to pass! the modules are easy and they each have a lab and/or model with it. she uses seesaw sometimes too! she gives great feedback and reminds you of weekly assignments! everything is open note btw and she even gives extra credit! i highly recommend her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: soooo much assignments, all of the tests and quizzes are mainly fill in the blank. I took this class online and I feel like I have learned nothing, if it was not for google I would probably fail this class because she teaches you nothing. she seems nice but I feel like a module, lab, quiz, and another assignment is a bit much to assign every week.
I loved her, the class was pretty easy and she was a good teacher.
She's super sweet and very understanding! Take her class!
I love her class!! It's never boring and it's always something new in each class.

I love her! she really cares about her students and answers your questions during and outside of class. you have to be in class to know how to do the assignments and participate, but a lot of it is with groups during class. tests are written response, but you can use notes. weekly homework (2-3 assignments a week), but not very time consuming.

Dr. Arias was a great professor to take online. The amount of work was constant all semester and she gives good feedback. However, this class is not super easy and you do have to do a good amount of work. Her tests and quizzes are like 90% written response

Dr. Arias is a nice professor, but her class is a bit overwhelming. There are many assignments that are time consuming. Modules are long. Due dates are pretty much back to back. The tests are extremely long with mostly open-ended questions. I did well in this class but it is a workload heavy class. Tests are on a lockdown browser with a camera.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Arias is a super nice professor and I highly recommend taking her. She makes what is seemly a boring class into something interesting. She is super kind and gives great feedback. She is one of those professors who you can tell really care about their profession.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She was a very nice lady, and she answered emails quickly. The class is comprised of a module and quiz every week, a summarizing activity about every other week, and 4 tests, and a final (cumulative). The quizzes were on a lockdown browser. The tests were pretty hard since they went much more in-depth than one would think.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: SHES WONDERFUL. I took both ISCI 2001 and 2002 with her this semester and it was totally manageable. I will say that there is A LOT of busy work, but content wise it is easy. I will finish both classes with a 98 with not much effort. You do need to study hard for the tests, but she is always willing to help and provides awesome and quick feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved Dr. Arias. She was super understanding, clear, and to the point. If you didn't understand something she was willing to help you understand. All of her tests were short answer with about 20-25 questions. For the final, you can make up 1 to 3 sections of the previous test that you didn't do well on to boost your grade.
